qas.question: What percentage of American death row prisoners are African American?
What percentage of people executed in the United States since 1976 have been African American?
What percentage of American prison inmates are African American?
What percentage of homicides were committed by Asians between 1980 and 2008?
What percentage of the American population is Hispanic?
What percentage of American death row prisoners are South American
What percentage of people executed in the United States since 1976 have been South American?
What percentage of American prison inmates are South American?
What percentage of homicides were committed by Canadians between 1980 and 2008?
What percentage of the Canadian population is Hispanic?

context: African Americans made up <a0_0><b5_0>41<b5_0/><a0_0/> percent of death row inmates while making up only 12.6 percent of the general population. (They have made up <a1_0><b6_0>34<b6_0/><a1_0/> percent of those actually executed since 1976.) However, that number is lower than that of prison inmates, which is <a2_0><b7_0>47<b7_0/><a2_0/> percent. According to the US Department of Justice, African Americans accounted for 52.5% of homicide offenders from 1980 to 2008, with whites 45.3% and Native Americans and Asians <a3_0><b8_0>2.2%<b8_0/><a3_0/>. This means African Americans are less likely to be executed on a per capita basis. However, according to a 2003 Amnesty International report, blacks and whites were the victims of murder in almost equal numbers, yet 80 percent of the people executed since 1977 were convicted of murders involving white victims. 13.5% of death row inmates are of Hispanic or Latino descent, while they make up <a4_0><b9_0>17.4%<b9_0/><a4_0/> of the general population.
